article.headline: Holy Cross 69, Bucknell 54
article.story: WORCESTER, Mass. (AP) -- Holy Cross won its 13th straight game and clinched the Patriot League regular season title with 69-54 victory over Bucknell on Wednesday night. The Crusaders (21-5, 12-1) will have homecourt advantage throughout the league tournament, which begins March 4. Kevin Hamilton scored 16 points to lead Holy Cross. The Crusaders led 48-42 with 7:17 to play when Hamilton and Greg Kinsey sparked a decisive 12-2 run to put the game away. John Griffin scored 15 points for Bucknell (18-9, 9-4). Bucknell pulled within six points when Chris McNaughton sank two free throws and Charles Lee another, making it 48-42. But Torey Thomas and John Hurley each sank two free throws, and Hamilton connected on a 3-pointer to push the lead to 55-42. Holy Cross was 20 of 22 from the free-throw line. Kinsey's 3-pointer with 4:43 left made it 60-44.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
